item.description: 前对冲基金经理、财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，在美国寻求重塑经济政策之际，他并不担心最近的经济衰退会使数万亿美元的资金从股票市场上消失。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, a former hedge fund manager, said he’s not worried about the recent downturn that’s wiped trillions of dollars from the equities market as the US seeks to reshape its economic policies.】

item.title: 评估股市下一步走势的交易员对资金流动保持警惕
item.description: 上周的大跌使 S&P 500 指数陷入调整，其相对平静的走势引人注目。现在，当投资者在市场情绪指标和关键价格水平上寻找复苏或进一步下滑的蛛丝马迹时，他们还需要关注一个更模糊的方面：市场流动性。【原文：The selloff that took the S&P 500 Index into a correction last week was notable for its relative calm. Now, as investors scour metrics of market sentiment and key price levels for hints of either a recovery or a further slide, they also need to watch a more nebulous aspect: market liquidity.】

In other news, Google is poised to buy an eye-tracking startup for glasses.】
